title: Why Index Funds Still Win (Yes, Still)
subtitle: Understanding the advantages of index funds in long-term investing.
content:
Why Index Funds Still Win (Yes, Still)

Here is why index funds still win. Yes, still.

1. Underperformance of Actively Managed Funds

90% of actively managed funds underperform index funds over time. That's not a fluke; that's the system. Notice how you hear this stat over and over again.

2. Cost-Effectiveness and Simplicity

Index funds are cheap, tax-efficient, and boring—just like me wearing the same shirt and saying the same thing every single video. It’s because it works.

3. Less is More

The more trades you make, the more mistakes you make. It’s part math, part psychology. If beating the market is your goal, you’ve already lost. Instead, go buy the whole thing and then go take a walk.

Conclusion

If any of this is helpful, check out my new podcast, Your Money Guide on the Side, by clicking the link in my bio.
